main event: A crescent-shaped object that appeared to split into halves, with the top and bottom halves disappearing alternately before resuming the original crescent shape.
interesting points: The object appeared to shift position horizontally within the northeast quadrant and change elevation, sometimes up and down.
The sighting was a casual observation from a moving automobile, with no optical aids used.
The sighting occurred on July 12, 1954, at night, in an area near San Antonio, Texas.
Weather conditions included clear skies with some clouds, no rain, and various wind speeds and directions at different altitudes.

The preliminary analysis by the Flying Safety Officer suggests the object was likely the quarter moon, and the apparent splitting, disappearing, and fragmenting was caused by clouds and/or ground objects, as well as the varying directions taken by the moving observer.
result: Likely the quarter moon, with the observed effects caused by environmental factors.
sighted object: Crescent-shaped object that appeared to split and reform
